snippet: An administrative court also banned four satellite networks considered sympathetic to supporters of the ousted president, Mohamed Morsi.
abstract: Two-month-old Egyptian government steps up its use of swift military trials to lock up Islamist supporters of Mohamed Morsi, and administrative court bans four satellite networks considered sympathetic to them; while government has promised prompt return to democracy, military trials and network closings extend its use of authoritarian tactics.

byline.contributor: Mayy El Sheikh and Kareem Fahim contributed reporting

lead_paragraph: An administrative court also banned four satellite networks considered sympathetic to supporters of the ousted president, Mohamed Morsi.

headline.main: Egypt Speeds Use of Trials for Jailing of Islamists
headline.print_headline: Egypt Speeds Use of Trials For Jailing Of Islamists

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
